tweets.html:
CBS should run "Crazy Ones" promos that say, "Watch this, or 'Sean Saves the World.' Your choice, but don't say we didn't warn you."

— Brian Lowry (@blowryontv) October 3, 2013

SLEEPY HOLLOW 2:SLEEPIER HOLLOW

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) October 3, 2013

Today in the Sleepy Hollow writers room: "Oh fuck, what if we actually have to come up with seven seasons worth of this stuff now?"

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) October 3, 2013

If the Colombian BREAKING BAD version of Jesse doesn't, at some point, scream "Ciencia, Perra!" then what are we even doing?

— Matt Fowler (@TheMattFowler) October 3, 2013

I've given this a lot of serious thought and here's what I've decided: Oliver Hudson was Joey Potter's worst boyfriend ever.

— Melissa Mann (@PhantomRat) October 3, 2013

Sorry, "Glee." I will not call your new couple "Dantana." Not after Operation Genoa. #NeverForget

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) October 3, 2013

*sees "Previously on #SOA" on screen* *goes to grab a beer* *refinishes deck* *returns* *episode starts*

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 3, 2013

@TVMcGee On the downside, by the time the bloated episode running time is over, it'll be time to refinish that deck again.

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) October 3, 2013

"SE7EN": great movie, hardest Wheel of Fortune puzzle ever

— Aaron Fullerton (@AaronFullerton) October 3, 2013

That was the worst "Big Bang Theory" I've seen. Since when did this show become "The Flintstones"?

— T Dog Media (@tdogmedia) October 4, 2013

The reviews aren't great, but let he who is without farts cast the first stone! #TheMillers

— Not Mags (@MargoFarts) October 3, 2013

Am I being too charitable if I give CBS continuity points for carrying over the fart jokes from The Millers to 2.5 Men?

— June Thomas (@junethomas) October 4, 2013

@junethomas How could they not advertise that as a Cross-Over Theme Night?

— Matt Fowler (@TheMattFowler) October 4, 2013

I literally cannot stop laughing at this Vine gag on Parks and Rec.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) October 4, 2013

Wait, Parks & Rec is trending?! Proof folks on Twitter smarter than the average Nielsen family.

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) October 4, 2013

Going from #ParksAndRec to #Scandal tonight will be going from "the way I wish government worked" to "yeah, this is how it works".

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 4, 2013

YOU CANT MERGE SPRINGFIELD AND SHELBYVILLE THIS IS AN ABOMINATION

— Bryan Murphy (@Bryan_Murphy) October 4, 2013

Sean Hayes is terrifying when he's that tiny and leaping at the bottom of the screen.

— Emma Fraser (@frazbelina) October 4, 2013

Ron Swanson tells off the SEAN SAVES THE WORLD lower third graphic https://t.co/NWWdFT5giS

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) October 4, 2013

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Hey, East Coast. Did Sean save the world?

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) October 4, 2013

Five minutes into last night's "Top Chef: NOLA" and confused that nobody has mentioned the vampire who run the town.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) October 3, 2013

So I guess I should try to remember what happened in the TVD finale? Something something Paul Wesley's face.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 3, 2013

One thing I can guarantee you all is that Stefan's hair still looks exactly the same immediately after he gets out of that safe.

— Paul Wesley (@paulwesley) October 4, 2013

Matt Donovan!!!!! #wellokaythen #TVD

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 4, 2013

What better way to catch up with Matt & Rebekah than to see them try to re-enact the final sex scene from SECRETARY? #TVD

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) October 4, 2013

Dear @julieplec can we please get a flashback episode of just Matt and Rebekah's European sex vacation? #TVD

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 4, 2013

"I have a weird feeling like something's bad about to happen.' You live in Mystic Falls, Elena. That feeling is known as "tomorrow." #TVD

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) October 4, 2013

I'm willing to suspend a lot of disbelief, #TVD, but we're meant to think these people went three months without mortally fucking shit up?

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) October 4, 2013

Paul mothereffin' Wesley, folks. #TVD

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 4, 2013

Stefan's water-logged hallucinations are directed by JJ Abrams. #TVD

— Melissa Mann (@PhantomRat) October 4, 2013

Silas's hair is very full of secrets. #TVD

— Melissa Mann (@PhantomRat) October 4, 2013

OH MY GOD HASN'T BONNIE BEEN THROUGH ENOUGH STOP PLEASE! #TVD

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) October 4, 2013

Is this Ford Fiesta commercial with one of #TheOriginals cast members playing their character canon? These are the things I worry about.

— GrahamB (@losthero47) October 4, 2013

Is it too late for every episode of #TheOriginals to be from Elijah's point of view? Because that would be very preferable indeed.

— Jennifer Schaefer (@jlschaefer) October 4, 2013

I refuse to take #TheOriginals seriously until they do an episode showing us how Chief Wiggum & Principal Skinner's P.I. business is doing.

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) October 4, 2013

None of my Elijah thoughts are appropriate to tweet in prime time. These are late night, pay cable thoughts I'm having. #TheOriginals

— Melissa Mann (@PhantomRat) October 4, 2013

Glee gets psychedelic. If this isn't an LSD PSA, then what are we even doing here?

— Brandon 🚷 (@bnowalk) October 4, 2013

"You guys, this is so great. I feel like I'm on Smash Season 1."

Did I write tonight's Glee? I'm pretty sure I wrote tonight's Glee.

— Louis Peitzman (@LouisPeitzman) October 4, 2013

As if Crosby and Jasmine weren't already a nightmare, they don't take wailing babies out of restaurants?? TEAM WAITER.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) October 4, 2013

Jurnee Smollett on #Parenthood is everything that is right and good.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 4, 2013

Wait. Julia's kid's school has parents go around and berate children for bringing non-recyclables in their lunch? DOUCHEY. #Parenthood

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 4, 2013

Nobody as cool as Lauren Graham doesn't know brb and g2g. The only show that gets the Internet right is Catfish.

— Brandon 🚷 (@bnowalk) October 4, 2013

P.S. What kind of cruel god would schedule Scandal and Parenthood against one another?

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) October 4, 2013

My expectations for tonight's #Scandal: some good twists, sharp dialogue, and that it makes me pregnant. No pressure, show.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 3, 2013

i am freakishly excited. It's driving everyone around me insane. #ScandalisBack

— shonda rhimes (@shondarhimes) October 4, 2013

Ready to get my #gladiator on. (If Liv ran out of popcorn) #scandal http://t.co/RMtNSFknCf

— Suzanne Scott (@iheartfatapollo) October 4, 2013

Here we go! Jesus be a bottle of Cab Sauv and a bag of Haribo gummi bears. #scandal

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) October 4, 2013

David Rosen. “@MyReality2013: @JoshMalina .....which character do you most identify with?”

— 🌎Joshua Malina🌎 (@JoshMalina) October 4, 2013

am i going to have to start watching scandal just so i know what the hell you guys are talking about

— pilot (@pilotbacon) October 4, 2013

Ok....I'm totally getting Olivia's issues with men. #OliviasDaddysIssues #ScandalisBack #Scandal #AskScandal

— Black Girl Nerds (@BlackGirlNerds) October 4, 2013

Daddy Joe just laid it low and spread it wide. #scandal

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) October 4, 2013

Cyrus Beene is wondering who stole all his dialogue. #Scandal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 4, 2013

Miles Bennett Dyson came out swinging. Skynet's about to be come self aware all over Olivia's feels. #Scandal #breaktwitter

— Ange (@angelamicela) October 4, 2013

Dude, Liv's Dad's monologue is freaking awesome. #Scandal

— Michael Salerno (@MikeNJD) October 4, 2013

"I am the hell and the highwater." Dude be stealin' my OKCupid profile headline. #Scandal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 4, 2013

OH MY GOD A RACIAL MOMENT IN THE FIRST 2 MINUTS. SWEET JESUS OH MY GOD. IT WAS A RACIAL MOMENT. UNSPOKEN BUT SO CLEAR. #scandal

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) October 4, 2013

Brotha from another Planet got us all silent. We in trouble y'all. #Scandal

— Yaba Blay (@fiyawata) October 4, 2013

The twice as good talk on primetime network tv?! #scandalisback

— Bri Montgomery (@freetobeBri) October 4, 2013

I'm through. I don't need no more. Not one more drop from this episode. #scandal

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) October 4, 2013

"I am the hell and the high water" is the new "I brought you into this world and I can take you out." #blackparenting #scandal

— jalylah (@jalylah) October 4, 2013

That speech from daddy Pope came with everything except a switch and time out! #scandal

— Rod Live Tweets (@RodLiveTweets) October 4, 2013

Dear White Pals who are #Gladiators that line about "being twice as good to achieve half" is a standard Black parent line! You're Welcome

— bevysmith (@bevysmith) October 4, 2013

Daddy gone crazy. And after 6 minutes in, I need a drink. #ABCScandal

— Kelli Marshall (@KelliMarshall) October 4, 2013

Well. That wasn't an intense beginning at all. #scandal #didallthatjusthappen

— Vulture (@vulture) October 4, 2013

#Scandal just schooled every show this fall on how it's done in only 6 minutes.

— Michael (@michaelcollado) October 4, 2013

"I am the heck, and the low tide." #ScandalFirstDrafts #Scandal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 4, 2013

The doors of the church are open, Liv. #ScandalisBack #Scandal

— Ange (@angelamicela) October 4, 2013

Is there a second screen app where I can just yell at Sally's face? #Scandal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 4, 2013

Meanwhile, Jake is still in the hole telling his invisible friend that "Felicity" was just a TV show. #Scandal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 4, 2013

"Start a kill folder on Olivia Pope." Only the first episode and I've already had five heart attacks.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) October 4, 2013

My entire TL is watching #Scandal, drinking wine, eating popcorn, and live tweeting. We should take over the world next.

— Issa Wonderful Knife (@xicacha) October 4, 2013

How in the world has Jeff Perry not booked an antacid sponsorship by now? #Scandal

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) October 4, 2013

From experience, I can tell you that playing the "ambitious slut card" rarely works out. #Scandal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 4, 2013

Look at all them Negroes Olivia dated. There's more black men in the photographs than in the whole of ABC programming. #shade #scandal

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) October 4, 2013

I wanna take diction classes from Joe Motherfreakin' Morton. #Scandal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 4, 2013

OMG. They just played the #bestmanholiday trailer with Blurred Lines accompanying. It's like…it's like they're targeting BLACK PPL. #scandal

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) October 4, 2013

Oh... my god. My entire timeline is Scandal. Now I know how non-Breaking Bad viewers must have felt, and I am so, so deeply sorry.

— Seth 🌹 (@mfpseth) October 4, 2013

Has a "Hi" ever been more intense? #Scandal

— Debra Birnbaum (@debrabirnbaum) October 4, 2013

Called my wife several times earlier. No answer. Forgot it was Scandal night. #WhatWasIThinking

— Lennox Lewis (@LennoxLewis) October 4, 2013

Olivia said "whore!" Everybody take a drink. #Scandal

— shonda rhimes (@shondarhimes) October 4, 2013

If you had "whore" in your drinking game...well, enjoy your coma. #Scandal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 4, 2013

See, if she had called me a HO, I would have jumped that damn table anyway, lol. #scandal

— ProfB (@AntheaButler) October 4, 2013

Imma need you to stop calling me a heaux, white lady. #Scandal

— Ange (@angelamicela) October 4, 2013

Liv, don't sit on the floor and get that white trench dirty!!! THAT is my current concern. #ThatTrench #CBTVScandal

— Awesomely Luvvie (@Luvvie) October 4, 2013

Hey look, it's Bellamy Young, showing Emmy voters why it was freakin' stupid that they overlooked her last year. #Scandal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 4, 2013

@AntheaButler why do black women in pain always end up caretaking for their white perpetrators?! #AskScandal

— petty bourgeois (@chknfriedtofu) October 4, 2013

Cyrus has had like six heart attacks since this episode started and is repressing them by sheer force of will. #Scandal

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) October 4, 2013

I am too agog to tweet. I have no tweets. #scandal

— Suzanne Scott (@iheartfatapollo) October 4, 2013

OMG...that scene in the bunker, with Liv, Fitz & Mellie ! A FRIGGIN MASTER CLASS, RIGHT?!?!? #ScandalisBack

— Jeff Perry (@jscandalp) October 4, 2013

I QUIVERRRR. I QUIVERRRRRR. CHRIST JESUS. #scandal #scandalisback

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) October 4, 2013

That was the best scene of any show this Fall thus far. I need a cigarette. AND I DON'T SMOKE. #Scandal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 4, 2013

Baggage Claim trailer now? NEGROES PAY ATTENTION. WE HERE NAH. WE GET TV COMMERCIALS AND SHIT ON PRIMETIME. WHOAA. #scandal

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) October 4, 2013

Okay Black people so we might not yet be at fancy car commercials or fancy beer or Ethan Allen furniture ad level but we comin up!! #scandal

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) October 4, 2013

Do not try to get me to watch this #Betrayal bullshit by evoking the power of Olivia and Fitz, ABC. DO. NOT. #Scandal

— Whitney McIntosh (@WhitneyM02) October 4, 2013

Mellie you betta get you one of those hammock necked secret service agents and go on about your bidness. #Scandal

— Ange (@angelamicela) October 4, 2013

#arewegladiatorsorarewebitches?

— shonda rhimes (@shondarhimes) October 4, 2013

Bitches.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) October 4, 2013

Are we Gladiators, or are we bitches? #scandal Git on it, CafePress!

— Matt Mitovich (@MattMitovich) October 4, 2013

Can't we just be bitchy #Gladiators? You know, the kind that snarks about TV on twitter? #scandal

— Suzanne Scott (@iheartfatapollo) October 4, 2013

I don't know why they call it #Scandal when they can just call it Superlatives.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) October 4, 2013

Is Mellie's maiden name Macbeth? #AskScandal

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) October 4, 2013

Mellie is my spirit animal. My angry, vindictive spirit animal. #Scandal

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 4, 2013

YOU GUYS. YOU GUYS. #SCANDAL

— tierney bricker (@tbrick2) October 4, 2013

SCANDAL is walking with a swagger. In heels. Click, click, click. Get the f--- out of its way, rest of TV.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) October 4, 2013

Hear that? That was the sound of a TV show dropping a mic. The gauntlet has been thrown, other shows that aren't Scandal.

— Alexa Planje (@HerQueue) October 4, 2013

And that's how you do a season premiere, everyone. #Scandal

— mesk (@_mesk) October 4, 2013

Is it 166 hours from now yet? #Scandal

— Whitney McIntosh (@WhitneyM02) October 4, 2013

Scandal is such a preposterous television show. I wish I could find a way to put it straight into my veins.

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) October 4, 2013

The only politicians I can imagine hating more than Sally Langston are Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer #Scandal

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) October 4, 2013

tweets.author_name: Beyonce has an uncle named Larry Beyince. Bruh....
tweets.html:
So yall want a president to divorce his wife and marry his black sidechick. Man Game of Thrones is more realistic. And that shit got dragons

— Beyonce has an uncle named Larry Beyince. Bruh.... (@DragonflyJonez) October 4, 2013

Thanking TV God that Scandal wasn't furloughed.

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) October 4, 2013
